body:
Hey guys,
Trying to learn Honeybee from this tutorial: [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=M4MA82_CPPA](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=M4MA82_CPPA)
But I have a problem. I should get this: [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/pIscpU3XjKFlIMYJaZOn-AWUUP49acshDFPftwEC6b1rhHQma8BbeaEwbDFXEkJT3yC7oelvus-kCCk2m-tcmCbuSlaTun7b/13548719_10208545990560205_906517161_o.png)
But I have sth like this: [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/pIscpU3XjKGbkokBt*Vzm8CAjIsGYW9Ol-fH0qPB8zQfzoCL28EY9X-DexbiEB9BIj86Utu-9btrxUshjnPcfDv-PLbx32Pq/problem.jpg)
And the problem is: 1. rpict: warning - non-planar vertex for polygon "230ba76672f44a149afe_65_0" I don't know what I did wrong. I went step by step with the tutorial.
Would be glad for any help! :)
topic: Honeybee Workshop Part 2/7 - problem: warning - non-planar vertex for polygon

replies.body:
So... I have the impression that I discovered what is my problem. Mentioned in the tutorial, the complexity of the context and the mess in defining surfaces. So now I have to somehow sort out...

Do anyone know the simpliest way to do that?

Hi,

that rpict warning is not fatal. Run a visualization of your scene via HBEE, and if it looks ok on screen, all should be well. In practice, it is very hard to fix all rpict errors a simulation spits out. In 99.9% of cases it does not mess up your results.

Best,

Max
